result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State

8:34 AM Defendant Joseph M. Poore in court.  Attorney Scott L. Stebbins in court for Joseph M. Poore.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Stebbins heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Deft would like to process with waiver of prelim.
8:36 Waiver of prelim.
PrelimQues/WOR.
Court reviews form with Deft.
Deft waives prelim.
Atty Stebbins is satisfied.
Court finds deft freely waives prelim and binds over for further proceedings.
8:37 Arraignment.
Copy of information. 
DA heard - will be filed today and will track the complaint.
Atty Stebbins- waives a formal reading and enters not guilty pleas to all counts.
Request status.
Court schedules with parties.
Court heard - the schedule may be a little behind the start time.
Atty Stebbins heard - has other matters in Oshkosh in the morning and may be a little late.
8:40 AM
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Atty Scott Stebbins appointed as dean atty - repayment by Deft of $100 per mth comm 10-15-2022

Report of SPD No Attorney Letter
Letter requesting ZOOM appearance by Deft - note from JA Deft not at Treatment Facility therefore to appear in person

3:36 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Poore appeared by ZOOM.
Court heard on letter from Public Defender's office regarding attempts to find counsel.
Court finds Deft filed waiver of prelim form.
DA heard - no waiver of right to counsel, requests matter be continued until counsel is found.
Court agrees and schedules matter.
Deft heard on treatment plan.
3:41 pm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter informing court attempts to secure counsel

9:37 AM Defendant Joseph M. Poore in court.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has spoken to the PD, qualifies but has not been appointed an atty yet.
Atty Lyon is present and is heard - will take the case, pending a conflict check.
Court reviews charges.
Atty Lyon heard.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim.
Waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.

Inmate correspondence form- ordered to be sealed by court

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Poore appeared by video, in custody. 
Court calls case. 
Court spks on communication sent from deft.
Court orders information to be sealed. 
DA spks on bond reduction.
Deft indicates that he would not be able to post bond. 
Court modifies bond to a $5,000 signature bond with same conditions as previously set in cash bond. 
Atty Spansail is in court room and is being heard- contact PD office if looking for representation. 
Deft agrees.
1:57 PM
with conditions

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Poore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen appeared by video.
Copy of comp.
Atty Hansen - received, waives reading.
DA heard on bail and priors.
Atty Hansen heard on bail.
Court sets $1,000 cash bail w/conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact w/known drug users or sellers, no contact w/D.H.. 
Court schedules w/parties.
1:44 pm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attachment JOS
